title: Tech companies must address impact on natural resources, failure threatens firms long term resilience: WEF
snippet: Global technology companies must urgently address their impact on natural systems and their dependence on natural resources otherwise this will threaten the long-term resilience of the tech companies, highlighted a report by the World Economic Forum (WEF).

title: Apple introduces Creator Studio Subscription for video, music and design professionals: How much it costs
snippet: Apple Creator Studio brings Final Cut Pro, Logic Pro and Pixelmator Pro into one subscription, adding AI-powered video, music and design tools for Mac and iPad, with premium content and student pricing, available from January 28.

title: Britain seeks reset in copyright battle between AI and creators
snippet: BRITAIN-TECH-AI-COPYRIGHT:Britain seeks 'reset' in copyright battle between AI and creators

title: Apple iPhone 17 available at Rs. 74,990? Check Flipkart Republic Day Sale early deals
snippet: Flipkart’s Republic Day Sale 2026 begins on January 17, with early deals already live. Apple’s iPhone 17 is available at an effective price of Rs. 74,990, including exchange benefits and bank offers, ahead of the main sale.

title: Google rolls out January 2026 Android 16 update: Eligible Pixel devices and what's fixed
snippet: Google has begun rolling out the January 2026 Android 16 update for Pixel devices, bringing bug fixes, performance improvements, battery optimisations, display fixes, and the latest security patches. The phased rollout will continue over the coming days.

title: Royal Enfield bikes are coming to BGMI: Bullet 350 and Continental GT 650 confirmed to arrive with January update
snippet: Krafton India and Royal Enfield have partnered to bring two iconic motorcycles to BGMI with the 4.2 update. Players can enjoy exclusive content and rewards, enhancing the gaming experience while aligning with the cultural interests of the community.

title: WhatsApp beta update could change how users share stickers on iOS: Here's how
snippet: WhatsApp is reportedly testing automatic sticker suggestions in its latest iOS beta, allowing relevant stickers to appear while users type emojis in chats. The feature could rely on emoji metadata and aims to make sharing stickers faster and more intuitive.

title: OpenAI wants to take on Apple with ChatGPT powered AI audio product: Report
snippet: OpenAI plans to compete with Apple AirPods by launching an AI-powered device codenamed 'Sweetpea', projected for September 2028. The device is expected to feature a unique design and advanced technology, including a custom chip and AI functionalities.

title: ​OnePlus 13 price crashes during Republic Day Sale: Here’s how much it costs now
snippet: OnePlus is hosting a Freedom Day sale with discounts on various products, including the OnePlus 13. The flagship device, originally priced at  ₹69,999, will see an  ₹8,000 price cut, bringing it to  ₹57,999 during the sale starting January 16.

title: Smartwatches to consider if the Apple Watch isn’t your first choice
snippet: Apple Watch alternatives focus on strong health tracking, long battery life and broad compatibility, making them appealing for users who want smart features without locking into Apple’s ecosystem.

title: Amazon holds talks with suppliers on pricing following tariff changes
snippet: The Financial Times reported earlier in the day that ‌the company was ‌seeking to cut what it pays suppliers for goods sold on ‌its e-commerce platform, as it moves to reverse concessions intended to soften the impact of U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs.

title: Venezuelans regain access to social network X after yearlong block
snippet: The social network X was once again accessible in Venezuela on Tuesday, more than a year after users were blocked by deposed president Nicolas Maduro, who was captured by US forces last week. title: US gives green light to Nvidia H200 chip exports to China
snippet: According to the regulations, the chips will be reviewed by a third-party testing lab ‌to confirm their technical AI capabilities before they can be shipped to China, which cannot receive more than 50% of the total amount of chips sold to American customers.

title: Inside India’s ten-minute reckoning; TCS & HCTtech CEOs on Q3 and beyond
snippet: Happy Wednesday! India’s fast-growing quick commerce industry was forced to slam the brakes on its “10-minute” delivery claim. This and more in today’s ETtech Morning Dispatch.

title: Wint Wealth secures Rs 250 crore in series B funding
snippet: Investment platform Wint Wealth has secured Rs 250 crore (about $27 million) from investors led by Vertex Ventures SEA & India to support its expansion plans. title: The dark side of dark stores
snippet: The army of on-the-clock delivery boys, imperilling themselves and pedestrians, has become a familiar sight across urban India. title: MeitY seeks higher budgetary allocation for its ECMS scheme
snippet: Meity is seeking a higher budget for its electronic component manufacturing scheme (ECMS) as industry demand exceeds expectations. title: Wellness brand Pee Safe closes a $32 million funding round with OrbiMed
snippet: Pee Safe has closed a $32 million round with OrbiMed, a global healthcare-focused private equity firm. The company plans to deploy the capital to scale its offline retail presence, strengthen marketing efforts, and deepen its reach across quick commerce platforms and marketplaces.

snippet: For decades, space stations have been largely staffed by professional astronauts and operated by a handful of nations. title: Good technology should change the world
snippet: The billionaire investor Peter Thiel (or maybe his ghostwriter) once said, “We were promised flying cars, instead we got 140 characters.” That quip originally appeared in a manifesto for Thiel’s venture fund in 2011. title: Meet the new biologists treating LLMs like aliens
snippet: How large is a large language model? Think about it this way. In the center of San Francisco there’s a hill called Twin Peaks from which you can view nearly the entire city. Picture all of it—every block and intersection, every neighborhood and park, as far as you can see—covered in sheets of paper.
